findings.rationale: The obligation to maintain confidentiality in perpetuity can be overly burdensome and may pose long-term risks to business operations.
findings.evidence_quote: The obligations under this Agreement shall continue in perpetuity and shall survive any termination of discussions between the parties.

findings.rationale: The clause requiring unlimited indemnification can expose a party to significant financial liability without any cap on damages.
findings.evidence_quote: Each party shall indemnify and hold harmless the other party from and against all claims, losses, damages, and expenses, without limit, arising out of any breach of this Agreement.

findings.rationale: Lack of limitation on liability can lead to excessive financial exposure for either party in case of disputes or breaches.
findings.evidence_quote: Notwithstanding any other provision, neither party's liability shall be limited under this Agreement.

findings.rationale: The automatic assignment of all intellectual property rights to Company A may limit the rights of the other party and could lead to disputes.
findings.evidence_quote: The receiving party hereby assigns all right, title, and interest in such work product.

findings.rationale: The clause allowing recovery of attorneys' fees by the prevailing party may discourage parties from pursuing legitimate claims due to potential high costs.
findings.evidence_quote: The prevailing party in any dispute shall be entitled to recover all attorneys' fees and costs from the non-prevailing party.
